channel.title: Editing their 3d models possible?
channel.description:
Alright well maybe im wrong on all this, but I was thinking:
Typically the graphics are held client side on any game. Does that mean we have the ability to add in better graphics into clients? With my game, editing a graphic in the client just causes a MAV(memory access violation). So if it's not possible to change the graphics, would it be with a private server? Or are the graphics just encrytped into a data file?
That leads me to a few other questions, would it be possible to perhaps change the scale on textures or exchange them for another texture? Perhaps add in a sky to runescape? I am a complete noob when it comes to "how runescape works." All I know is that if I could change the graphics in runescape, I'd make a hi-res 3d client.

item.title: Editing their 3d models possible?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

[quote author=jme_009 link=topic=2612.msg24421#msg24421 date=1146893331]

PaulT:

Typically the graphics are held client side on any game. Does that mean we have the ability to add in better graphics into clients?

Yes. I have edited the textures and upgraded the graphics a few times by editing the client. I can write a tutorial on how to do a few basic things that make it run smoother and look nicer. It's all clientside stuff. Editing textures and shit like that requires alot of java knowledge and a lot of time...I do it in text. I've been trying to develop a utility for directly editing the datafiles.

Cool! Well hopefully I can learn more about it soon. I don't know much java but I know enough about how graphics work in games and stuff.
Would scaling a texture just involve changing some numbers? For what I use(in blitz3d) it's just ScaleEntity x,y would java be similar?

Yes. You can do that clientside if you find the right numbers.

I have a lot of 3d models, (2 thousand dollars worth). What file formats would be accepted? All I have is .x, .b3d, and .3ds

Probably none, though you could probably convert the models into RS format. Anything is possible if want it bad enough, but it just be easier to not even worry about that yet. Ah, I'm going to bed soon.

Read full topic
